Letâ€™s rid ourselves of all of the bad editors! (if you donâ€™t mind the turn of phrase).Most of what took place on OLTL this past week pleasantly surprised me. Soap-heaven help me, I still like John and Marty. Johnâ€™s reaction to Marty as she flashed back on her the manipulated-rape sex with Todd was a reminder that there are soap writers who still realize that itâ€™s so much easier for fans to root for good men â€“ we get so few of them in daytime. Many of us still love men who are sensitive to the needs of others, rather than focus on themselves and their own pain. LOVED that moment when John reminded Marty that he was always willing to wait for her â€“ sheâ€™s worth it. The only thing that made the scene even remotely awkward was watching Blair seduce Todd at the same time Marty had difficulty being touched by John because of Toddâ€™s assault of her. If the writers wanted to make some of us squeamish about Todd and Blair, job well done. Otherwise? Bad editing job on this one. It made Todd and Blair seem completely disconnected from the world around them, belligerently insular. They seemed to not care about how much damage had been done to others in their time apart.

Blair, who was disgusted by Toddâ€™s treatment of Marty, seems to have absolutely no qualms about his actions, now. She was disgusted enough before to want to keep his children from him. Now? She canâ€™t keep her hands off of him.

I would much rather have had long soulful talks between the two rather than strip scenes and â€œshame-filledâ€ sex. The problem with the writing for the once magnificent Todd and Blair is that that the writers donâ€™t seem invested in having them break the inch deep-mile wide pattern theyâ€™ve established as part of their courtship. OLTL writers have seem to always bank on the hard work of Kassie DePaiva and Trevor St. John in winning back fans to the â€˜Todd and Blair corner to bring romance back to the show. I think theyâ€™ll have to reconsider, this time. Too much damage has been done and an instant reunion most likely wonâ€™t give them the bump theyâ€™re looking for. How instant is instant in their case? Todd/Blair reunions can be summarized by the following dialogue:

â€œYou hurt meâ€ (Todd to Blair, Blair to Todd, it doesnâ€™t matter).

â€œYou donâ€™t mean thatâ€ (Todd to Blair, Blair to Todd, it doesnâ€™t matter)

They have sexâ€¦ AND SCENE!

Where is the discussion about what they want and why they want it? What about some insight into why they dragged Marty and John into their psychodrama? How about some part humorous/part dramatic couples counseling for them? What about real consideration about Teaâ€™s feelings? Itâ€™s bad enough that Todd cheated on Tea after she put everything on the line for him, her life included, but he then lied and said that it meant nothing that heâ€™d had sex with Blair. If it wasnâ€™t a lie that having sex with Blair meant nothing to him? It makes his actions even worse. The writers rubbed salt in fansâ€™ wounds by having Todd coldly state to Blair that he was leaving her to go after Tea â€˜because sheâ€™s worth itâ€™.

Hells bells, people, you know that despite Teaâ€™s fault, Iâ€™m a fan of the goddess of grand bitchery but for TODD to state who is â€˜worthyâ€™ and who isnâ€™t? Well that just burns my grits. I would have loved watching Blair get up off the chaise lounge and slap Todd back to his infancy (which would finally allow his external state match his internal state)! Marty, Tea, Blair, his sister Viki, and even his own daughter, Starrâ€¦ just how many women in Llanview are going to end up emotionally scarred thanks to this guy? Taking Todd down the dark road for the sake of pimping â€œStarr and Coleâ€ is a decision that still haunts this show. The writers havenâ€™t been able to find their â€˜Todd mojoâ€™ and get anything right with this character since then.

Despite the detour and bad editing, I enjoy Marty and John.

What else was there to love?

SO, hereâ€™s what I loved

B â€“ That thereâ€™s a possibility of a Schuyler-Gigi pairing â€“ the actors have an amazing onscreen chemistry. Rex and Gigi have been terminally cute.
